intro: Chaetospora distans, commonly known as the slender haircap moss, is a species of moss belonging to the family Dicranaceae. It is characterized by its delicate, grass-like appearance and is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and rocky areas. The plant has a dense, cushion-like growth form with branching stems covered in short, stiff hairs. Its sporophytes are typically small and develop on the tips of the stems, producing capsules for spore dispersal. Chaetospora distans plays a role in soil stabilization and provides habitat for small invertebrates in its native ecosystems.
